intro: Nitrosalsola aegaea, commonly known as the Canary Island star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves and produces underground bulbs that store nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but is considered invasive in some regions.
